subject: Science
content: Plants make food using sunlight, water, and air. This process is called photosynthesis.
summary_simple: Plants make food using sunlight, water, and air. This process is called photosynthesis.
summary_medium: Plants make food using sunlight, water, and air. This process is called photosynthesis. The process is used to create food using the elements of water, air, and sunlight.

It is also known as photosynthesis, or photosynthesis in the plant language of the plant world. For more information, go to www.photosynthesis.org.

subject: Science
content: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into food and oxygen.
summary_simple: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into food and oxygen.
summary_medium: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into food and oxygen. Photosynthesis is also known as the process of photosynthesis.
summary_advanced: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into food and oxygen. Photosynthesis is also known as the process of photosynthesis or photovoltaic cells. The process is thought to be one of the most important in the world's history. It helps plants grow food, oxygenate water, and produce oxygen.

subject: Science
content: Photosynthesis involves light-dependent reactions in the thylakoid membranes and light-independent reactions in the stroma, producing glucose and oxygen.
summary_simple: Photosynthesis involves light-dependent reactions in the thylakoid membranes. Photosynthesis produces glucose and oxygen.
summary_medium: Photosynthesis involves light-dependent reactions in the thylakoid membranes. Photosynthesis produces glucose and oxygen by light-independent reactions in stroma.
summary_advanced: Photosynthesis involves light-dependent reactions in the thylakoid membranes. Photosynthesis produces glucose and oxygen by light-independent reactions in stroma, producing oxygen and carbon dioxide. The photosynthetic process takes place in the light-rich atmosphere of the Earth's atmosphere. The sun plays a key role in the photosynthesis of plants.

subject: Science
content: Mitosis is when a cell splits to make two identical cells.
summary_simple: Mitosis is when a cell splits to make two identical cells.
summary_medium: Mitosis is when a cell splits to make two identical cells. Mitosis is also known as cell division or cell fusion. It is a process that occurs when two cells are joined.
summary_advanced: Mitosis is when a cell splits to make two identical cells. Mitosis is also known as cell division or cell fusion. It is a process that occurs when two cells join together to form a single cell. The process is known as mitosis or cell division. It occurs in the cells of the human body.

subject: Science
content: Mitosis is a type of cell division that results in two daughter cells, each with the same number and type of chromosomes as the parent.

summary_medium: Mitosis is a type of cell division that results in two daughter cells, each with the same number and type of chromosomes as the parent.

Mitosis is also known as cell division or cell division by means of mitosis. It is the process of dividing a single cell into two separate cells.

subject: Science
content: Mitosis includes phases: prophase, metaphase, anaphase, and telophase, ensuring equal chromosome distribution.

subject: Math

subject: Geography
content: The water cycle describes how water moves from oceans to the atmosphere and back to land.

content: Evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and collection are the main stages of the water cycle.

subject: Science

subject: Geography
content: Continental drift theory explains how tectonic plate movements shaped the current distribution of continents over geological time.
summary_simple: Continental drift theory explains how tectonic plate movements shaped the current distribution of continents.
summary_medium: Continental drift theory explains how tectonic plate movements shaped the current distribution of continents over geological time. Continental drift theory is based on the theory of plate tectonics.
